title: Frei Brothers 2015 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Stony lemon and a twist or two of grass dot zesty acidity in this clean, crisp and focused white, sure to be a pleasurable quaffer.

title: Grafen Neipperg 2014 Trocken Spätburgunder (Württemberg)
description: Succulent black cherry perfume is accented by hints of granite and smoked nut in this inviting Pinot Noir. The palate is fresh and approachable, boasting loads of ripe black cherry and plum flavors. Sunny acidity and soft, feathery tannins augment its easy, appealing feel. Drink now through 2020.

title: Château Pindefleurs 2014  Saint-Émilion
description: Strongly dominated by its wood aging, this is a toasty, licorice and dark-coffee-flavored wine. It does have some black-fruit weight that should allow the wine to balance out. So wait until at least 2019 before drinking.

title: Château Saransot-Dupré 2014  Listrac-Médoc
description: From one of the leading estates in Listrac, this is a ripe structured wine. It has firm tannins and a dark core of dry wood aging. Balanced with that is the blackberry fruit and generous superripe Merlot. The wine needs time, so don't drink before 2019.

title: Cristom 2014 Mount Jefferson Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Light raspberry fruit carries a tart punchy edge. It's clean and fresh, though showing little density. Additional bottle age (another couple of years) would be a good idea.

title: Dezzani 2012 San Carlo  (Barolo)
description: This opens with subdued aromas of dark berry, cake spice, espresso and a whiff of pressed violet. On the straightforward palate, hints of white pepper and star anise add depth to dried morello cherry while solid tannins lend support.

title: Adega Viuva Gomes 1969 Reserva Tinto Red (Colares)
description: This wine looks mature, with its brown rim. It also tastes very mature, a herbal wine with tight tannins and a powerful structure. It is probably moving towards old age, a wine to drink now for its richness and density, and for the story of the old vines in sandy soil on the west coast of Portugal.

title: Azienda Agricola Monti 2010  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
description: Enticing scents of fragrant purple flower, fleshy plum and cake spice lift out of the glass. The straightforward palate doles out ripe blackberry, dried black cherry and black pepper alongside rounded tannins. Drink soon.

title: Casa de la Ermita 2013 Crianza Red (Jumilla)
description: Floral berry and plum aromas are lightly woody. This feels full and edgy, with fairly hard tannins. Black-fruit flavors are certainly ripe, while this finishes bold and intense, with scratchy tannins. The blend is Monastrell, Tempranillo and Cab Sauvignon.

title: Castorani 2012 Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)
description: Mature plum, chocolate and truffle aromas set the stage on this enjoyable red. The juicy, straightforward palate offers red cherry, raspberry and star anise framed in solid tannins.

title: Charles Smith 2014 Eve Chardonnay (Washington)
description: Very pretty aromas of freshly cut apple, grape skin and white flowers lead to a palate full of clean, rounded fruit flavors. It's a spot-on example of the variety that shows no apparent new oak influence.

title: Château Beauregard Lagupeau 2014  Graves
description: This structured wine, dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon, is firm while also fruity. It has a solid core that is surrounded by softer berry fruits and acidity. As the wine develops, it will have a fine balance between this structure and its fruitiness. Drink from 2018.

title: Château des Landes 2014 Cuvée Tradition  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)
description: Still structured, the wine is firm with the tannins that will allow it to age. It is dense, hinting at the juicy black fruits that are developing. As it matures, the tannic structure will integrate into the generous fruitiness. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Fourcas Dupré 2012 Zenith de Fourcas Dupré  (Listrac-Médoc)
description: This is the second wine of Fourcas Dupré. It is soft, full of ripe berry fruits and attractive acidity. The core of the wine is still dry and shows plenty of tannic structure that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2019.

title: Black's Station 2014 Malbec (Yolo County)
description: Bright, vivid flavors like black cherry and cranberry make this wine taste fresh and alive. Medium body and a somewhat tart but polished texture balance it out.

title: Burmester 2012 Red (Douro)
description: This rich, fruity wine has soft tannins that are balanced with generous dark-berry fruits. The wine with its bright fruitiness and dry core is now ready to drink.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paicines)
description: Extremely rocky and dusty aromas of turned earth and tobacco meet with snapped dark chocolate on the nose of this bottling from a little-known region 30 miles inland from the Monterey Bay. Espresso bean and black plums show on the impressively dark palate that is well structured, finishing on slight hints of roasted pepper and peppercorns.

title: Douro Prime 2011 Inquieto Reserva Red (Douro)
description: This concentrated wine brings tannins together with superripe black fruits and a firm aftertaste. A bite of alcohol spoils the rich fruitiness. Drink from 2018.

title: Eguren Ugarte 2013 Cincuenta  (Rioja)
description: Raspberry, strawberry and oaky shoe polish aromas comprise the nose on this pinching rubbery Rioja from a cold vintage. Plum, cherry and raspberry flavors finish fresh and ripped, with tannins that won't quit. Drink through 2020.

title: El Xamfrà 2013 Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Briny, bready aromas of apple cider set up a smooth but slightly soft palate. Flavors of nectarine and green herbs finish short and briny, like an echo of the nose. Drink now.

title: Monterebro 2014 Barrica Monastrell-Syrah (Jumilla)
description: Slightly rustic earthy aromas of animal, blackberry, plum and cola feed into a jammy palate with just enough acidic pop. Chocolaty blackberry flavors are touched up by resiny oak, while this blend of 85% Monastrell and 15% Syrah tastes similar on a persistent finish.

title: Kooyong 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Mornington Peninsula)
description: The 2015 Estate Chardonnay is a fruit-foward wine, offering bright pineapple and citrus flavors that reverberate on the refreshing finish. On the whole, it is straightforward, with an approachable texture.

title: Pacific Rim 2015 Twin Vineyards Gewürztraminer (Yakima Valley)
description: Vibrant aromas of lychee, white flowers and spice give way to off-dry fruit flavors, with the concentration seeming a bit light. Still, it delivers a lot of appeal.

title: Finca La Emperatriz 2010 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Spicy generic berry aromas come with an herbal component and a note of licorice root. This feels tight and compact, but not overly ripe. Berry fruit flavors are herbal and the slightest bit green, with a black-pepper note in front of a rubbery finish with clamping tannins.

title: Finca La Estacada 2012 Reserva Varietales Red (Uclés)
description: Aromas of ripe black fruits, graphite, dry herbs and licorice root are solid and encouraging. This Tempranillo blend from La Mancha feels choppy and tight, while screechy red-plum and cherry flavors finish a bit raw and hollow.

title: Finca Las Moras 2015 Paz Malbec (San Juan)
description: Dark and dense in color, this San Juan Malbec smells of jammy plum, prickly berry fruits and spice. A raw rugged palate is home to flavors of spiced black plum, tomato and herbs. On the finish, this tastes lightly herbal, with grip and drying tannins.

title: Pikes 2014 Traditionale Riesling (Clare Valley)
description: This is a traditional, dry Clare Riesling, with a linear, lean profile and crisp acids. Crushed stone accents lemon-lime flavors. Oyster me, please!

title: Mamete Prevostini 2014 Sassella  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: Aromas of oak, coconut, blue flower and a whiff of exotic spice lead the nose. The linear palate is on the lean side, offering tart red cherry, raspberry, anise and oak-driven spice alongside fine-grained tannins and firm acidity.

title: Markham 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a fleshy, voluptuous white, offering smooth, creamy texture around well-defined characteristics of melon, honeysuckle and peach.

title: Gård 2014 Grand Klasse Reserve Roussanne (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of spice, apricot, and Creamsicle are followed by full-bodied fruit and barrel flavors, showing some warmth on the finish.
